response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "This measure has been amended to establish requirements for kauhale projects, including reporting requirements by the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [CHUNK_18] The measure also requires the Auditor to conduct a management and performance audit of the Kauhale Initiative and establishes the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program. [CHUNK_19, CHUNK_20] Your Committee on Conference has also deleted language that would have appropriated funds for supportive housing projects and supportive services for certain households in those projects. [CHUNK_21]",
  "appropriations": "The Committee on Conference has inserted appropriation amounts of $18,575,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $24,325,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_19] Additionally, appropriation amounts of $2,525,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $5,855,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 have been inserted for the continued implementation of the Ohana Zones Pilot Program. [CHUNK_20]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "",
  "agency_impact": "The measure now requires the Auditor to conduct a management and performance audit of the Kauhale Initiative and report to the Legislature. [CHUNK_19] The Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions is now required to submit a report every four months to the Legislature detailing the expenditure of funds. [CHUNK_21, CHUNK_22] The bill also specifies that the Coordinator on Homelessness shall report directly to the Director of Human Services. [CHUNK_23]",
  "economic_impact": "",
  "policy_impact": "This measure has been amended by establishing the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program within the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [CHUNK_20] Language that would have appropriated funds for supportive housing projects and supportive services has been deleted. [CHUNK_21] The effective date has also been changed to July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_23]",
  "revenue_sources": "",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "This measure inserts appropriation amounts of $18,575,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $24,325,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_19] It also inserts appropriation amounts of $2,525,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $5,855,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the Ohana Zones Program. [CHUNK_20] Establishing the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program implies ongoing costs beyond the initial two-year appropriation. [CHUNK_20] The measure also requires the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to submit a report every four months to the Legislature, which may have minor, ongoing administrative costs. [CHUNK_21, CHUNK_22]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The establishment of the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program within the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions will result in ongoing fiscal obligations for the state after the initial six-year period. [CHUNK_20]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The Committee on Conference has amended this measure by inserting specific appropriation amounts for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Program for FY 2025-2026 and FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_19, CHUNK_20] The Ohana Zones Program has been established as a permanent program, a significant change from its previous pilot status. [CHUNK_20] New requirements include an audit of the Kauhale Initiative by the Auditor and quarterly expenditure reports from the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [CHUNK_18, CHUNK_22] The measure also deletes appropriations for supportive housing projects and changes the effective date to July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_21, CHUNK_23]"
}

parts.text:
{
  "overview": "This measure has been amended to establish requirements for kauhale projects, including reporting requirements by the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [CHUNK_18] The measure also requires the Auditor to conduct a management and performance audit of the Kauhale Initiative and establishes the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program. [CHUNK_19, CHUNK_20] Your Committee on Conference has also deleted language that would have appropriated funds for supportive housing projects and supportive services for certain households in those projects. [CHUNK_21]",
  "appropriations": "The Committee on Conference has inserted appropriation amounts of $18,575,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $24,325,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_19] Additionally, appropriation amounts of $2,525,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $5,855,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 have been inserted for the continued implementation of the Ohana Zones Pilot Program. [CHUNK_20]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "",
  "agency_impact": "The measure now requires the Auditor to conduct a management and performance audit of the Kauhale Initiative and report to the Legislature. [CHUNK_19] The Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions is now required to submit a report every four months to the Legislature detailing the expenditure of funds. [CHUNK_21, CHUNK_22] The bill also specifies that the Coordinator on Homelessness shall report directly to the Director of Human Services. [CHUNK_23]",
  "economic_impact": "",
  "policy_impact": "This measure has been amended by establishing the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program within the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [CHUNK_20] Language that would have appropriated funds for supportive housing projects and supportive services has been deleted. [CHUNK_21] The effective date has also been changed to July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_23]",
  "revenue_sources": "",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "This measure inserts appropriation amounts of $18,575,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $24,325,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_19] It also inserts appropriation amounts of $2,525,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $5,855,000.00 (HB431_CD1_CCR189_.htm.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the Ohana Zones Program. [CHUNK_20] Establishing the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program implies ongoing costs beyond the initial two-year appropriation. [CHUNK_20] The measure also requires the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to submit a report every four months to the Legislature, which may have minor, ongoing administrative costs. [CHUNK_21, CHUNK_22]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The establishment of the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program within the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions will result in ongoing fiscal obligations for the state after the initial six-year period. [CHUNK_20]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The Committee on Conference has amended this measure by inserting specific appropriation amounts for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Program for FY 2025-2026 and FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_19, CHUNK_20] The Ohana Zones Program has been established as a permanent program, a significant change from its previous pilot status. [CHUNK_20] New requirements include an audit of the Kauhale Initiative by the Auditor and quarterly expenditure reports from the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions. [CHUNK_18, CHUNK_22] The measure also deletes appropriations for supportive housing projects and changes the effective date to July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_21, CHUNK_23]"
}

chunk_details.chunk_text: HB431 SD2 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 431 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 H.D. 2 STATE OF HAWAII S.D. 2 A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO HOUSING . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: PART I SECTION 1. There is appropriated out of the general revenues

SECTION 1. There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued

may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative , including expenses related to: (1) The development and operation of kauhale; (2) The provision of project-based rent supplement payments; (3) The provision of support services for qualified individuals and families in kauhale; (4) Staffing

services for qualified individuals and families in kauhale; (4) Staffing and related costs to administer the kauhale initiative; (5) Addressing basic needs of individuals and families experiencing homelessness; (6) Wrap around services; (7) Social and health care services; (8) Transportation; and (9) Other services with the goal of alleviating poverty

and (9) Other services with the goal of alleviating poverty and transitioning individuals and families experiencing homelessness or housing instability into supportive or affordable housing; provided that all kauhale projects shall be connected to public utilities, including water, sewer, and electricity; provided further that the kauhale initiative may charge monthly

electricity; provided further that the kauhale initiative may charge monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level. The sums appropriated shall be expended by the department of human services for the purposes of this part. SECTION 2. There is appropriated out of the

this part. SECTION 2. There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for

thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued implementation of the ohana zones pilot program established under Act 209, Session Laws of Hawaii 2018. The sums appropriated shall be expended by the department of human services for the purposes of this Act. PART II SECTION 3.

for the purposes of this Act. PART II SECTION 3. There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be

the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the development, operation, and maintenance of affordable, supportive housing projects and the provision of supportive services for households with special needs who reside in the supportive housing projects . The sums appropriated shall be

the supportive housing projects . The sums appropriated shall be expended by the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation for the purposes of this part. PART III SECTION 4. This Act shall take effect on July 1, 3000. Report Title: DHS; HHFDC; Housing; Kauhale Initiative; Ohana Zones Pilot Program; Supportive

DHS; HHFDC; Housing; Kauhale Initiative; Ohana Zones Pilot Program; Supportive Housing; Appropriations Description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Human Services for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program. Requires kauhale to be connected to public utilities. Authorizes monthly rents of no more than 30%

public utilities. Authorizes monthly rents of no more than 30% of the area median income level to be charged for kauhale. Appropriates funds to the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation for the development of supportive housing projects and the provision of supportive services for certain households in the supportive

provision of supportive services for certain households in the supportive housing projects. Effective 7/1/3000. (SD2) The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.

CCR189 CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REP. NO. 189 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 431 H.D. 2 S.D. 2 C.D. 1 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular

D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madam and Sir: Your Committee on Conference on the disagreeing vote of the House of Representatives to the amendments proposed by the Senate in H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL

H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO HOUSING," having met, and after full and free discussion, has agreed to recommend and does recommend to the respective Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure

bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds for: (1) The continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program; and (2) The development of supportive housing projects and the provision of supportive services for certain households in the supportive housing projects.

supportive services for certain households in the supportive housing projects. Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by: (1) Establishing requirements for kauhale projects, including reporting requirements by the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions; (2) Requiring the Auditor to conduct a management and performance audit of the

Auditor to conduct a management and performance audit of the Kauhale Initiative and report to the Legislature; (3) Inserting appropriation amounts of $18,575,000 for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $24,325,000 for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the Kauhale Initiative; (4) Establishing the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent

Initiative; (4) Establishing the Ohana Zones Program as a permanent program within the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions; (5) Inserting appropriation amounts of $2,525,000 for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $5,855,000 for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued implementation of the Ohana Zones Pilot Program; (6) Deleting language that

of the Ohana Zones Pilot Program; (6) Deleting language that would have appropriated funds for supportive housing projects and supportive services for certain households in those projects; (7) Requiring the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to submit a report every four months to the Legislature detailing the expenditure

report every four months to the Legislature detailing the expenditure of funds appropriated toward the Kauhale and Ohana Zones initiatives and conduct a comprehensive needs assessment and submit a report on the assessment to the Legislature; (8) Changing references to the Governor's Coordinator on Homelessness to "Coordinator on Homelessness"; (9)

the Governor's Coordinator on Homelessness to "Coordinator on Homelessness"; (9) Specifying that the Coordinator on Homelessness shall report directly to the Director of Human Services; (10) Changing the effective date to July 1, 2025; and (11) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed

for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the managers of your Committee on Conference that is attached to this report, your Committee on Conference is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, S.D. 2, as

purpose of H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, S.D. 2, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Final Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, S.D. 2, C.D. 1. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the managers: ON THE PART OF THE SENATE ON THE PART

managers: ON THE PART OF THE SENATE ON THE PART OF THE HOUSE ____________________________ JOY A. SAN BUENAVENTURA Chair ____________________________ LISA MARTEN Co-Chair ____________________________ STANLEY CHANG Co-Chair ____________________________ LUKE A. EVSLIN Co-Chair ____________________________ HENRY J.C. AQUINO Co-Chair ____________________________ JENNA TAKENOUCHI Co-Chair

HB431_CD1_CCR189_.chunk_text: HB431 SD2 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 431 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 H.D. 2 STATE OF HAWAII S.D. 2 A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO HOUSING . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: PART I SECTION 1. There is appropriated out of the general revenues

SECTION 1. There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued

may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative , including expenses related to: (1) The development and operation of kauhale; (2) The provision of project-based rent supplement payments; (3) The provision of support services for qualified individuals and families in kauhale; (4) Staffing

services for qualified individuals and families in kauhale; (4) Staffing and related costs to administer the kauhale initiative; (5) Addressing basic needs of individuals and families experiencing homelessness; (6) Wrap around services; (7) Social and health care services; (8) Transportation; and (9) Other services with the goal of alleviating poverty

and (9) Other services with the goal of alleviating poverty and transitioning individuals and families experiencing homelessness or housing instability into supportive or affordable housing; provided that all kauhale projects shall be connected to public utilities, including water, sewer, and electricity; provided further that the kauhale initiative may charge monthly

electricity; provided further that the kauhale initiative may charge monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level. The sums appropriated shall be expended by the department of human services for the purposes of this part. SECTION 2. There is appropriated out of the

this part. SECTION 2. There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for

thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued implementation of the ohana zones pilot program established under Act 209, Session Laws of Hawaii 2018. The sums appropriated shall be expended by the department of human services for the purposes of this Act. PART II SECTION 3.

for the purposes of this Act. PART II SECTION 3. There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be

the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the development, operation, and maintenance of affordable, supportive housing projects and the provision of supportive services for households with special needs who reside in the supportive housing projects . The sums appropriated shall be

the supportive housing projects . The sums appropriated shall be expended by the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation for the purposes of this part. PART III SECTION 4. This Act shall take effect on July 1, 3000. Report Title: DHS; HHFDC; Housing; Kauhale Initiative; Ohana Zones Pilot Program; Supportive

DHS; HHFDC; Housing; Kauhale Initiative; Ohana Zones Pilot Program; Supportive Housing; Appropriations Description: Appropriates funds to the Department of Human Services for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program. Requires kauhale to be connected to public utilities. Authorizes monthly rents of no more than 30%

public utilities. Authorizes monthly rents of no more than 30% of the area median income level to be charged for kauhale. Appropriates funds to the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation for the development of supportive housing projects and the provision of supportive services for certain households in the supportive

provision of supportive services for certain households in the supportive housing projects. Effective 7/1/3000. (SD2) The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.

Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular

D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madam and Sir: Your Committee on Conference on the disagreeing vote of the House of Representatives to the amendments proposed by the Senate in H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL

H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO HOUSING," having met, and after full and free discussion, has agreed to recommend and does recommend to the respective Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure

bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds for: (1) The continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program; and (2) The development of supportive housing projects and the provision of supportive services for certain households in the supportive housing projects.

supportive services for certain households in the supportive housing projects. of the Ohana Zones Pilot Program; (6) Deleting language that would have appropriated funds for supportive housing projects and supportive services for certain households in those projects; (7) Requiring the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to submit a report every four months to the Legislature detailing the expenditure

the Governor's Coordinator on Homelessness to "Coordinator on Homelessness"; (9) Specifying that the Coordinator on Homelessness shall report directly to the Director of Human Services; (10) Changing the effective date to July 1, 2025; and (11) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style.
